metadata.dcterms:title: Single-blind, Placebo-challenge Study of Intravenous Fluid Hydration in the Management of Pediatric Migraine in the Emergency Department
metadata.dcterms:creator: Richer, Lawrence
Craig, William
Rowe, Brian
metadata.dcterms:description: This study evaluated the overall response to intravenous fluid hydration and the effect of expected medication treatment on the pain response among children and adolescents with migraine in an urban Emergency Department.
metadata.dcterms:subject: Medicine, Health and Life Sciences
emergency departments
emergencies
pediatrics
treatment expectation
randomized controlled trial
migraine disorders
headache disorders
metadata.dcterms:isReferencedBy: Richer, L., Craig, W. and Rowe, B. (2014) Randomized Controlled Trial of Treatment Expectation and Intravenous Fluid in Pediatric Migraine. Headache: The Journal of Head and Face Pain, 54: 1496-1505., doi, 10.1111/head.12443, http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/head.12443/abstract
